title: n8n vs AutoGen: Which workflow automation Tool is Better in 2026?
metaDescription: Compare n8n vs AutoGen. See pricing, features, pros & cons to choose the best workflow automation tool for your needs in 2026.
introduction: Choosing between n8n and AutoGen for your workflow automation needs? Both are popular tools in the AI space, but they have different strengths, pricing models, and use cases. This comprehensive comparison breaks down the key differences to help you make an informed decision.

sections.title: Overview: n8n vs AutoGen
paragraphs: n8n is n8n is a fair-code workflow automation platform with native AI capabilities, combining visual workflow building with custom code flexibility. Features 400+ integrations, self-hosting options, and AI agent support including RAG systems. Enables teams to build powerful automations while maintaining full control over data and deployments.. It's known for workflow-automation, ai-agents, integration.

AutoGen, on the other hand, is AutoGen is an open-source framework from Microsoft Research for building and orchestrating multi-agent AI systems. It enables developers to create, manage, and coordinate multiple conversational AI agents—each with specialized roles, capabilities, and tools—to collaboratively solve complex tasks through structured dialogue. Its unique value lies in its flexible, code-centric approach to agent definition and its seamless integration with human oversight, making it a powerful tool for automating intricate workflows that require reasoning, tool use, and iterative problem-solving.. Users choose it for multi-agent-systems, conversational-ai, workflow-automation.

sections.title: Pricing Comparison
paragraphs: When it comes to value for money, consider your specific use case and team size. n8n offers a free tier, making it great for getting started.

sections.title: Features & Capabilities
paragraphs: n8n excels in: 400+ integrations and API connections, Visual workflow builder with code option, AI agents and agentic capabilities. This makes it ideal for teams that need workflow-automation.

AutoGen stands out with: Customizable, conversable agent programming with adjustable LLM backends (OpenAI, Azure OpenAI, Anthropic, etc.), Built-in support for role-based agent patterns (e.g., Assistant, UserProxy, GroupChat) with customizable system prompts, Seamless code execution, debugging, and human-in-the-loop feedback within agent conversations. It's particularly strong for users focused on multi-agent-systems.

sections.title: Use Cases: When to Choose Each Tool
paragraphs: Choose n8n if: You need workflow-automation, work with ai-agents, or require flexible pricing.
Choose AutoGen if: You prioritize multi-agent-systems, work in conversational-ai, or prefer their pricing model.

sections.title: Pros & Cons
paragraphs: n8n Pros: Verified platform, Featured tool, Highly rated (4.8/5), Extensive feature set.
n8n Cons: Some limitations on free tier.
AutoGen Pros: Verified platform, Highly rated (4.7/5), Comprehensive features.
AutoGen Cons: May have feature limitations.

verdict: Both n8n and AutoGen are solid choices for workflow automation. Your choice depends on your specific requirements: n8n is better for workflow-automation, while AutoGen excels at multi-agent-systems. Consider trying both with their free tiers or trials to see which fits your workflow better.
